required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of LJP 394 in Lupus Patients With History of Renal Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Three-Arm, Parallel-Group, Multicenter, Multinational Safety and Efficacy Trial of 300 mg and 900 mg of Abetimus Sodium in Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE) Patients With a History of Renal Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this study is to determine whether abetimus sodium is more effective than placebo in delaying time to renal flare in SLE patients with a history of renal disease.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Interim efficacy analysis indicated it would be futile to continue study.

primary_outcome.measure: To determine whether abetimus sodium is more effective than placebo in delaying the time to renal flare in SLE patients with a history of SLE renal disease. Weekly administration with a 52-week treatment duration.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Time to event (12 months fixed treatment duration)

secondary_outcome.measure: To determine whether treatment with abetimus sodium is more effective than placebo in delaying the time to Major SLE flare; and to determine whether treatment with abetimus sodium (LJP 394) is more effective than placebo in reducing proteinuria.

arm_group.description: 300 mg (three 2 mL vials of abetimus sodium plus six 2 mL vials of normal saline) administered i.v (in the vien) weekly
900 mg (nine 2 mL vials of abetimus sodium) administered i.v. (in the vein) weekly
A volume of 18 mL (Nine 2 mL vials) of identically appearing placebo (phosphate-buffered saline) administered i.v. (in the vien) weekly

intervention.description: 300 mg (50 mg/mL)abetimus sodium (three 2 mL vials of of abetimus sodium plus six 2 mL vials of normal saline) administered i.v. (in the vien) weekly for 52 weeks
900 mg (50 mg/mL) abetimus sodium (nine 2 mL vials) administered i.v. (in the vien) weekly for 52 weeks.
A volume of 18 mL (nine 2 mL vials of normal saline) of identically appearing placebo (phosphate-buffered saline) administered i.v. (in the vien) weekly for 52 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
- Active SLE renal disease within past 4 years.
- Males or females between 12 and 70 years old.
- Females must be non-pregnant and non-lactating. Females and males must use adequate birth control methods during course of study.
- Ability to have weekly intravenous (IV) administration of study treatment.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active SLE renal disease within past 3 months prior to entering study.
- Use of the following therapies within 3 months prior to entering the study: alkylating agents, e.g., cyclophosphamide, TNF inhibitors, cyclosporine.
- Use of mycophenolate mofetil that exceeds 1000 mg/day, azathioprine that exceeds 100 mg/day, methotrexate that exceeds 10 mg/week, leflunomide that exceeds 10 mg/day within 2 months prior to entering study.
- Use of rituximab within 6 months prior to entering study.
- Current abuse of drugs or alcohol.
